title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game engine OpenXRay gets taken down on GitHub
description: OpenXRay is an improved cross-platform version of the X-Ray Engine, which is the original game engine used in the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game series by GSC Game World. However, it seems a bad actor got it taken down from GitHub.

title: Pillars of Eternity from Obsidian has a new patch coming nearly 9 years after release
description: Well this is quite a surprise isn't it. Obsidian Entertainment have announced a new patch is coming and now in Beta on Steam for their 2015 RPG the Pillars of Eternity.

title: MSI officially announced the Claw A1M handheld with Intel
description: Well there it is! MSI Claw A1M is the official name of the next big vendor to jump into the handheld gaming space to take on the likes of the Steam Deck, ROG Ally and the Lenovo Legion Go.

title: Cross-distribution support improvements coming for Canonical's Snap packages
description: Well, 2024 should be interesting for Linux packaging! While many distributions use different packaging formats like deb, rpm and others there's also Flatpak for cross-distro support. But we also have Canonical's Snap - which is going to get improved cross-distro support.

title: OpenAI say it would be 'impossible' to train AI without pinching copyrighted works
description: I really fear for the internet and what it will become in even just another year, with the rise of AI writing and AI art being used in place of real people. And now OpenAI openly state they need to use copyrighted works for training material.

title: Unity cutting 25% of staff (about 1,800 people) as part of restructuring
description: Ouch. We're only just into week 2 of 2024 and Unity Software are cutting away a huge amount of their staff, as things aren't looking great for the Unity game engine.

title: GE-Proton 8-26 and 8-27 released with various game fixes for Steam Deck / Linux
description: GE-Proton has received two new versions with GE-Proton 8-26 and GE-Proton 8-27 shortly after, mostly focusing on fixing up issues in some games and pulling in new versions of various parts of Proton like Wine and DXVK.

title: Celebrate Economic Strategy with the Steam Captialism and Economy Fest
description: Economy simulation and city management may not be the first thing most people think of when they think about video games. But it is one of the most longstanding genres in gaming, going all the way back to the 1980's.
